titlestmt.titleproper: John S. and James L. Knight Foundation records, RG 5 Program Files, Subgroup: Grant Files (L-Z)
A Guide to the John S. and James L. Knight Foundation records, RG 5 Program Files, Subgroup: Grant Files (L-Z), Accession 2021:051 FA1790

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-11-01 04:27:08 UTC.

did.unittitle: John S. and James L. Knight Foundation records, RG 5 Program Files, Subgroup: Grant Files (L-Z), Accession 2021:051

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: John S. and James L. Knight Foundation

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Knight Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Knight Foundation.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records more than 10 years old are open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains grant records (L-Z) for Knight communities (Miami, Philadelphia, Detroit, San Jose, Charlotte, Akron, Macon, St. Paul, Columbus, Grand Forks, and Milledgeville) with a focus on Knight grant program areas including Community and National initiatives, Journalism and Media Innovation, Art, Technology, Learning and Impact, and Trustee-Advised grants. Most grant records include information about the purpose of the grant, the amount gifted, and a final report (where applicable). Each grant has its own grant number which usually represents the year the grant application was filed followed by a unique identifier.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in series according to various Knight program areas:

did.unittitle: Community and National Initiatives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Community and National Initiatives program focuses on enhancing local communities by attracting talent, encouraging economic opportunities, and promoting community engagement. This series also contains grants that fall under the Knight Cities Challenge in which grants awarded under this challenge benefit one of the 26 Knight communities and focus on talent, opportunity, or engagement.
